lines.text: There's no human problem that can't be solved by kindness.
What's a lawyer?
Well, if you ever get into trouble, a lawyer is a person who gets you out of trouble.
Oh, my. I could use one almost every day!
Do you know why you are here this time?
Yes, Ma'am.
Then tell me why.
Don't *you* know?
When I was young, we didn't have a play problem because we didn't have time to play!

[on a painting]
Just suppose the figure of that lovely child should suddenly come to life. Suppose it smiled at you and waved its hand. What would you do?
I'd call a doctor!
Curly, you're an old flatterer.
Is that something bad?
Well, I think I will send for that doctor.
I should if I were you! And before the doctor arrives, allow me to be the first to congratulate you.
Congratulate me for what?
My dear, you're about to become a mother.
Edward Morgan, insanely jealous and acting like a sixteen-year-old Romeo! Oh, this is the happiest day of my life!

[Extreme close-up and directly into the camera]
Oh, my goodness!
Can I have my surprise first?
Yes, indeed you may. Here you are, young lady, a string of pearls.
Pearls? They look just like those little stones on the beach.
Elizabeth!
Do you like them?
I'd really rather have a pair of roller skates.
Well, we'll throw those in for good measure.
Oh, my duck does a wonderful trick. My duck can lay an egg.
And just what is so wonderful about that?
Well, can *you* lay an egg? (pause)... Oh, excuse me.
How would you like it if you and I got to be very, very good friends?
I don't think I would like it, sir.
Child, you're absolutely uncontrollable.
Yes, Ma'am!
I like to make things to eat, and I especially like to eat them.
I've got a friend that ...
Oh, I bet that isn't true.
What?
You said you had a friend. I bet you have *lots* of friends.
Under the circumstances, I have made every allowance for you, but when you bring animals into the dormitory, I must act.
That's what my daddy and mommy used to do!
What?
Act!
Oh, I've gone mad, Aunt Genevieve. Delightfully mad!
From now on, she's going to have all the lovely things in life, just because she has a right to them.
[both sobbing]
Henrietta, what are you blubbering about?
I can't help it. I'm so happy.
There's no need to be sentimental.
Well, what are *you* crying for?
Why shouldn't I? Why can't I be happy, too?
Thank you, sir.
Thank *you*, miss.
Why, I didn't do anything!
[Elizabeth gestures at Reynolds to crouch]

[still standing]
What is it, Miss?
Couldn't you come down here so I can talk to you?
I wish you wouldn't bow so much.
I'm sorry, miss.
[bows]
There you go again. You make my back ache.
I have every reason to believe that Jimmy Rogers means to propose to Mary before the summer is over.
How do you know that?
I looked at him.
My word, miss. You *are* a package.
Mary said that I was going to live in Jimmy's house. Does that mean that Jimmy's getting married to me, too?
Uncle Edward, I don't want to get married to Jimmy.
Well, why not?
Because I want Mary and me to get married to you.
Curly, you're a designing woman, you know that, don't you?

[singing]
Curly Top! You little bundle of joy! Curly Top! You're like a wonderful toy!
Edward, you may as well admit that you're in love with Mary. Why don't you tell her so?
Haven't you heard the news, Aunt Genevieve? It just so happens Mary is engaged to Jimmie Rogers.
Have you ever told her that you love her?
